verses.roman:
tato bāhu-sahasreṇa
nānāyudha-dharo 'suraḥ
mumoca parama-kruddho
bāṇāṁś cakrāyudhe nṛpa

synonyms: tataḥ—thereupon; bāhu—with his arms; sahasreṇa—one thousand; nānā—numerous; āyudha—weapons; dharaḥ—carrying; asuraḥ—the demon; mumoca—released; parama—supremely; kruddhaḥ—angry; bāṇān—arrows; cakra-āyudhe—at Him whose weapon is the disc; nṛpa—O King (Parīkṣit).
translation: Carrying numerous weapons in his thousand hands, O King, the terribly infuriated demon shot many arrows at Lord Kṛṣṇa, the carrier of the disc weapon.
